contents: The ISC License text changed 'and' to 'and/or' in July 2007.

contents.contents:

IN NO EVENT SHALL ISC BE LIABLE FOR ANY SPECIAL, DIRECT, INDIRECT, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES OR ANY DAMAGES WHATSOEVER RESULTING FROM LOSS OF USE, DATA OR PROFITS, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, NEGLIGENCE OR OTHER TORTIOUS ACTION, ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE USE OR PERFORMANCE OF THIS SOFTWARE.

<copyright notice>

Permission to use, copy, modify, and /or distribute this software for any purpose with or without fee is hereby granted, provided that the above copyright notice and this permission notice appear in all copies.

THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS" AND THE AUTHOR DISCLAIMS ALL WARRANTIES WITH REGARD TO THIS SOFTWARE INCLUDING ALL IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE AUTHOR BE LIABLE FOR ANY SPECIAL, DIRECT, INDIRECT, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES OR ANY DAMAGES WHATSOEVER RESULTING FROM LOSS OF USE, DATA OR PROFITS, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, NEGLIGENCE OR OTHER TORTIOUS ACTION, ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE USE OR PERFORMANCE OF THIS SOFTWARE.

contents.contents: notice - These licenses contain few restrictions, allowing original or modified third-party software to be shipped in any product without endangering or encumbering our source code. All of the licenses in this category do, however, have an "original Copyright notice" or "advertising clause", wherein any external distributions must include the notice or clause specified in the license.

raw.googleLicenseTypeDescription: notice - These licenses contain few restrictions, allowing original or modified third-party software to be shipped in any product without endangering or encumbering our source code. All of the licenses in this category do, however, have an "original Copyright notice" or "advertising clause", wherein any external distributions must include the notice or clause specified in the license.

contents.contents: A license is allowed if Fedora determines that the license is a free software / open source license. At a high level, the inquiry involves determining whether the license provides software freedom, and (equivalently) making sure that the license does not place burdens on users' exercise of its permissions that are inconsistent with evolving community norms and traditions around what is acceptable in a free software / open source license. See below for more on the history of Fedora licensing policy.
These licenses use robust language but either fail to address patents explicitly or require more than simple notice of license terms and copyright notices.

contents: These licenses use robust language but either fail to address patents explicitly or require more than simple notice of license terms and copyright notices.

contents.contents:
USE CASE Source code delivery OR Binary delivery
	YOU MUST Provide Copyright notices
	YOU MUST Provide License text

raw.osadlRule:
USE CASE Source code delivery OR Binary delivery
	YOU MUST Provide Copyright notices
	YOU MUST Provide License text

It is unclear whether "any portion of the software" assumes code changes and additions that also must be distributed "only under this license". In addition, a "license that complies with this license" may or may not be interpreted as a copyleft clause. If not, the copyleft condition would depend on the mode of delivery which would require a case-by-case assessment. Therefore, a general recommendation on the compatibility of the MS-PL license can only be given for selected cases. If not, the copyleft condition would depend on the mode of delivery which would require a case-by-case assessment. Therefore, a general recommendation on the compatibility of the MS-PL license can only be given for selected cases.

Software under a copyleft license such as the MS-RL license normally cannot be redistributed under a non-copyleft license such as the ISC license, except if it were explicitly permitted in the licenses.
Non-copyleft licenses such as the NBPL-1.0 license and the ISC license are generally considered mutually compatible.
Non-copyleft licenses such as the NCSA license and the ISC license are generally considered mutually compatible.
Non-copyleft licenses such as the NTP license and the ISC license are generally considered mutually compatible.
Non-copyleft licenses such as the OLDAP-2.8 license and the ISC license are generally considered mutually compatible.

The final statement of the appended SSLeay License "The licence and distribution terms for any publically available version or derivative of this code cannot be changed" normally must be interpreted as a copyleft clause, but there is no general consensus on this interpretation. Therefore, a recommendation on the compatibility of the OpenSSL license can only be given for selected cases. contents: A permissive license lets people do anything with your code with proper attribution and without warranty. The ISC license is functionally equivalent to the BSD 2-Clause and MIT licenses, removing some language that is no longer necessary.

How to apply this license:
Create a text file (typically named LICENSE or LICENSE.txt) in the root of your source code and copy the text of the license into the file. Replace [year] with the current year and [fullname] with the name (or names) of the copyright holders.

permissions._str:
Actions:
- Ol Use the obtained source code without modification (Use the fetched code as it is.)
- Ol Modify the obtained source code.
- Ol Using Modified Source Code
- Ol Use the retrieved object code (Use the fetched code as it is.)
- Ol Use the retrieved binaries (Use the fetched binary as it is.)
- Ol Use the object code generated from the modified source code
- Ol Use binaries generated from modified source code
- Ol Use the retrieved executable (Use the obtained executable as is.)
- Ol Use the executable generated from the modified source code

Conditions: None

permissions._str:
Actions:
- Ol Distribute the obtained source code without modification (Redistribute the code as it was obtained)
- Ol Distribute the obtained object code (Redistribute the code as it was obtained)
- Ol Distribute the fetched binaries (Redistribute the fetched binaries as they are)
- Ol Distribution of Modified Source Code
- Ol Distribute the object code generated from the modified source code
- Ol Distribute the generated binaries from modified source code
- Ol Distribute the obtained executable (Redistribute the obtained executable as-is)
- Ol Distribute the executable generated from the modified source code

Conditions:
Ol OBLIGATION: Include a copyright notice, list of terms and conditions, and disclaimer included in the license

contents.contents: This approved license list enumerates the licenses that the Eclipse Foundation has approved for third-party content used by its projects. Inclusion in this list does not imply that the Eclipse Foundation has determined that every one of these licenses can be used by your Eclipse Foundation project. That is, the licenses on this list are not necessarily compatible with every Eclipse Foundation project license, or with each other.

Lizenzen ohne Copyleft-Effekt zeichnen sich dadurch aus, dass sie dem Lizenznehmer alle Freiheiten einer Open Source Lizenz einräumen und für Veränderungen der Software keine Bedingungen hinsichtlich des zu verwendenden Lizenztyps enthalten. Damit kann der Lizenznehmer veränderte Versionen der Software unter beliebigen Lizenzbedingungen weiterverbreiten, also auch in proprietäre Software überführen.

Die hier aufgeführten Lizenzen entsprechen den Voraussetzungen der Free Software Definition und Open Source Definition. Sie
werden nach ihren lizenzrechtlichen Charakteristika in folgende Kategorien unterteilt:

* [Lizenzen ohne Copyleft-Effekt](#lizenzen-ohne-copyleft-effekt-permissive-licenses)
* [Lizenzen mit strengem Copyleft-Effekt](#lizenzen-mit-strengem-copyleft-effekt)
* [Lizenzen mit beschränktem Copyleft-Effekt](#lizenzen-mit-beschränktem-copyleft-effekt)
* [Lizenzen mit Wahlmöglichkeiten](#lizenzen-mit-wahlmöglichkeiten)
* [Lizenzen mit Sonderrechten](#lizenzen-mit-sonderrechten)

Software unter solchen Lizenzen kann als Freie oder Open Source Software bezeichnet werden. Bei einigen der aufgeführten Lizenzen ist umstritten oder unklar, ob diese Anforderungen erfüllt sind, da die relevanten Definitionen, die Free Software Definition und die Open Source Definition nicht identisch sind und zudem Lizenztexte nicht immer eindeutig formuliert sind. Diese Lizenzen sind mit "Einordnung unklar" gekennzeichnet.

Software unter solchen Lizenzen kann als Freie oder Open Source Software bezeichnet werden. Bei einigen der aufgeführten Lizenzen ist umstritten oder unklar, ob diese Anforderungen erfüllt sind, da die relevanten Definitionen, die Free Software Definition und die Open Source Definition nicht identisch sind und zudem Lizenztexte nicht immer eindeutig formuliert sind.
